channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Who is Jill Biden’s ex-husband, William Stevenson, who is charged with murdering his wife?
The notorious legacy of Chinese-origin mafia families behind Myanmar’s deadly scam centres
More Gen Z and millennials are getting cancer. Here’s why
Who killed Saif al-Islam Gaddafi? The violent end of Libya's once-anointed heir
Bangladesh invites India as an election observer. How does this work?
Is India really stopping Russian oil imports as Trump claims?
Balochistan in flames: Why India must watch Pakistan closely and up its guard
item.description: An immediate terror strike may not be Asim Munir’s move, but the risk could rise in the months ahead. India’s security managers must remain on high alert

item.title: How India-US trade deal underscores Bharat’s resolve, strategic resurgence
item.description: With the Indo-American trade deal now concluded, India looks to a strategic reset of comprehensive ties with the US, demonstrating to the world that a resurgent Bharat has secured its place under the sun

item.title: How Bangladesh elections look like a fixed match for Jamaat and foreign interests
item.description: Regardless of the results of an election where one out of two major parties has been banned and a third, extreme one, has been raised to extreme influence, chaos shall reign until the balance is reset

item.title: Shadow Warrior | The Epstein Files expose elite depravity
item.description: Politicians and the ultra-rich can often operate with impunity. Extreme wealth may act as a shield against repercussions

item.title: How Union Budget 2026 offers a blueprint for Viksit Bharat
item.description: Union Budget 2026–27 does not merely announce growth; it institutionalises it through industrial ecosystems, de-risked private investment, city-scale economic regions, and a national skilling agenda. Its central philosophy: pragmatism enables ambition

item.title: Genius Plan vs Brain Drain: Why China is leading the tech war while India is falling behind
item.description: India, now the fourth-largest economy in the world, has much soul-searching to do. If talent abroad does not wish to return, and talent at home is desperate to leave, it is a damning commentary on how merit is treated within the system
